summary: Feature request to add a 'Getting Started' section to README.md with links to tutorials, guides, and API documentation

analysis.summary: User requests a curated 'Getting Started' section in README.md with links to introduction guides, platform-specific tutorials, and API docs. The README has been improved since 2019 with badge links to API docs and guides, but still lacks a dedicated Getting Started section. The request remains partially valid — the README has docs/guide badges but no prominent onboarding section for new users.

keySignals.text: I am just starting with using SkiaSharp and the first thing I noticed was it wasn't obvious as to where to go to get started
keySignals.interpretation: New-user onboarding pain point — documentation discovery is poor

keySignals.text: Could we add a 'Getting Started' to the readme.md?
keySignals.interpretation: Concrete proposal for a specific README improvement

keySignals.text: I'd be happy to collaborate on this and help out
keySignals.interpretation: Reporter offered to contribute — community engagement opportunity

codeInvestigation.relevance: README already has badge links to SkiaSharp API Docs, HarfBuzzSharp API Docs, and SkiaSharp Guides — partial coverage of what was requested, but badges are easy to miss and not organized as a 'Getting Started' section
The 'Using SkiaSharp' section only covers NuGet install, not how to actually use the API. No code examples, no 'hello world', no tutorial links in the main text
Building section links to documentation/building.md — shows pattern of linking to detailed docs, which could be replicated for a Getting Started section
15 documentation markdown files exist covering architecture, building, APIs, etc. — but no getting-started.md or introduction.md for new users
Samples directory exists with Basic and Gallery projects, but README doesn't prominently link to these for new users

fieldRationales.expandedReason: The request is specifically about improving documentation — adding a Getting Started section to the README with links to tutorials, guides, and API docs. No code change or new functionality is requested.

alternatives.whyRejected: While it improves the README, the content is purely about documentation links and onboarding text, not a code or feature enhancement.

fieldRationales.expandedReason: The change targets README.md which is project documentation. The area/Docs label is the correct fit for documentation improvements.

The request is still partially valid — while the README has been improved with badge links since 2019, it still lacks a dedicated Getting Started section. The reporter offered to contribute. This is a low-effort improvement that would help new users.

uncertainties: Whether the maintainer considers the current badge links sufficient for new user onboarding
Whether the Xamarin-era tutorial links from 2019 are still current or need MAUI equivalents
assumptions: Assumed the request is still relevant despite being from 2019, since the README still lacks a dedicated Getting Started section

resolution.hypothesis: New users struggle to find getting-started resources because the README lacks a prominent onboarding section. The badge links exist but are not discoverable by users looking for a clear starting point.

proposals.title: Add Getting Started section to README
proposals.description: Add a '## Getting Started' section between the platform list and 'Using SkiaSharp' with links to the SkiaSharp guides, API docs, and samples directory. Low effort, high discoverability improvement.
proposals.codeSnippet:
## Getting Started

New to SkiaSharp? Here are some resources to help you get started:

- **[SkiaSharp Guides](https://docs.microsoft.com/xamarin/graphics-games/skiasharp/)** — Tutorials and walkthroughs
- **[API Documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/SkiaSharp/)** — Complete API reference
- **[Samples](samples/)** — Example projects for various platforms
- **[Skia API Reference](https://skia.org/)** — Underlying Skia engine documentation

proposals.title: Create a dedicated getting-started.md
proposals.description: Create documentation/getting-started.md with step-by-step setup for each platform (MAUI, WPF, Console, Blazor) and link from README. More comprehensive but higher effort.

proposals.title: Enhance existing 'Using SkiaSharp' section
proposals.description: Instead of a new section, expand 'Using SkiaSharp' to include a minimal code example and links to guides alongside the NuGet install instructions.

resolution.recommendedProposal: Add Getting Started section to README
resolution.recommendedReason: Lowest effort, directly addresses the request, and follows the existing README pattern of linking to detailed docs.

actionability.reason: Valid documentation improvement request. README still lacks a dedicated Getting Started section despite having badge links. Low-effort change with high value for new users.

actions.reason: Matches classification as a documentation request about project docs

actions.description: Acknowledge request and note partial progress since 2019
actions.reason: Issue has had zero comments since 2019 — a response acknowledges the valid request and provides context on what already exists

payload.draftBody:
Thanks for the suggestion. The README has gained some documentation links since this was filed (API docs and guides badges at the top), but a dedicated Getting Started section would make these more discoverable for new users.

A section like this between the platform list and "Using SkiaSharp" would address the gap:

```markdown
## Getting Started

New to SkiaSharp? Here are some resources to help you get started:

- **[SkiaSharp Guides](https://docs.microsoft.com/xamarin/graphics-games/skiasharp/)** — Tutorials and walkthroughs
- **[API Documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/SkiaSharp/)** — Complete API reference
- **[Samples](samples/)** — Example projects for various platforms
```

Contributions welcome if you'd still like to help with this.
